newsitem.title: USA: Nike shares fall on rumors of lost orders.
newsitem.headline: Nike shares fall on rumors of lost orders.

text.p: The stock of Nike Inc. slid in heavy trading Tuesday after a footwear trade magazine reported that the industry leader might have lost some significant orders for the critical back-to-school season.
Nike's class B stock fell as low as $63 on the New York Stock Exchange, where it was by far the most active issue with 6.1 million shares changing hands. It closed 62.5 cents lower at $66.375.
Sporting Goods Intelligence cited "outside sources" in its report that retailer Big Foot had cancelled some Nike futures orders.
Salomon Brothers analyst Brett Barakett called the magazine report "rumors ... unsubstantiated and untrue."
He repeated his strong recommendation to buy Nike's stock, citing its recent low prices. "This is a very compelling investment right now," he said.
Gruntal raised its rating on the stock to outperformer from long-term outperformer.
Also, Woolworth Corp. said a market rumour that its sporting good retail unit, Foot Locker, had reduced its orders from Nike were untrue.
A Nike spokesman said the Beaverton, Ore.-based company could not comment on the magazine report because it is in the quiet period before the upcoming release of its fiscal third-quarter earnings.
